column4: why does locate irssi for ex. still list files in /var/ after using apt-get purge?
the locate command uses a database. that database gets updated like 1 a day
use 'sudo updatedb' to force a update of the locate database
locate uses the database. :) so its as acurate as the last time it got updated..
does it look for every related file to the programm being removed?
purge removes config files for apps as well as the app.
just the config files..   the idea of 'every related file' is a little broad. :)
and its just the SYSTEM config files. not custome user configs.
well i compiled a file and installed it with apt-get and found some hidden file in my home dir
files in the users HOME dir are NOT going to be removed by the package manager system
unless you did somthing very.. weird..
uhm, what if its something like ./irssi/config
double check that path..  if you mean .irssi/stuff in the users home.. the package manager should NOT be affecting files/dirs in the users home dirs.
i didnt do anything funny i just dont want files spread like config files that would have stuff like auto connect
the users keep track of their own config files in their home dirs.. not the system package manager.
